creator: ashish.arondekar@zurich.com
text:
Hello,

I have written my a custom tag and the doStartTag() I use 

======================================
pageContext.setAttribute("attr1", "someValue1", PageContext.SESSION_SCOPE);
=======================================

In a another SERVLET (the same session) I try to access this session variable
using 

======================================
session.getValue("attr1") 
======================================

and it returns null! Why ? Is this is bug or is there a restriction on using 
session values between servlets and JSP's. 
If do a session.getAttribute("attr1") in a JSP I see the session value.

Looking forward to hear from you soon,
Ashish

creator: Larry.Isaacs@sas.com
text:
Based on what you say, I know of no reason it shouldn't work.  There isn't
enough info here to be sure to exactly duplicate your problem.  Please attach
a simple web application which demonstrates your problem so we can be sure
to fix your exact case.

creator: cmanolache@yahoo.com
text:
I'll mark it as invalid until we get more data to reproduce it. We should change
the state of the bug after evaluation.

I think there is some bug somewhere as I am having the same problen. on dev 
environment we had problems. Now we are having problems on UAT running on Win2K.

We are realy in big problem because whole applciation has stopped working in 
UAT on Win2K

HEEEEEELP
